programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Everything is coming up roses on Martha's Bedford farm; join Martha while she creates new garden with almost 200 roses.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Welcome to Martha's woodland gardens. Martha's azalea grove is bursting with the last flowers of spring. Everything you need to know about hostas. Martha takes up bird watching.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Martha's Amazing Maze and How to Grow Trees From Seedlings
programme.desc: Welcome to Martha's passion project: the maze on her Bedford farm. Learn how to properly plant trees including measuring, fertilizing, and watering. Plus, how to start trees from seedlings.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Everything You Need To Know About Conifers
programme.desc: Martha celebrates all things conifers, the cone-bearing trees that are typically evergreens. Go inside the Christmas tree farm on her Bedford farm and learn how to properly move an established tree.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.sub-title: How to Make Croissants and Sourdough Bread
programme.desc: Martha journeys through her local area in search of the ultimate fresh-baked croissants and sourdough bread; learning about homemade bread and pastries.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.sub-title: One Pot Wonders With Jamie Oliver
programme.desc: Martha is in the test kitchen with English chef, restaurateur, and author Jamie Oliver, and they're cooking up a mouth-watering menu of dishes that are easy to make.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha and her niece Sophie visit their favorite tea shop, Arogya, in Westport, Conn., to discover the do's and don'ts of making tea; they return to Martha's kitchen to create dishes with tea.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha visits Mast Market in Mt. Kisco, N.Y., and learns the art behind making their renowned chocolate; from roasting cacao, to stone grinding, to forming delicious bars and chips.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha shares techniques for making the perfect burgers; Pat LaFrieda joins Martha to grind his beef mix; Thomas Joseph joins to make a hake fish burger and Martha shares her turkey burger.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.sub-title: Today's Catch: Fish Recipes for Everyday
programme.desc: Hannah Heimbuch and Martha demonstrate how to prepare fish for cooking; Chef Marcus Samuelsson makes cured king salmon and halibut en papillote; Martha breaks down a Dungeness crab.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha's friend and restaurateur, Shiva Natarajan, shares the key to making any Indian dish - spices; back in Martha's kitchen, they make butter chicken, lemon rice, and a tangy yogurt sauce.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha learns about the magic of mushrooms; mushroom expert Andrew Carter explains each mushroom variety; Martha and mushroom cookbook author Andrea Gentl make delicious mushroom recipes.

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Nothing beats a steakhouse dinner. Martha makes a classic martini, baked stuffed clams, porterhouse steak with compound butter, creamed spinach, and baked potatoes

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha sheds light on the world of mushrooms with four recipes: buckwheat crepes with mushroom filling, vegetarian mushroom ragu, French mushroom soup, and mushroom risotto

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha reimagines five classic sandwich recipes: roasted chicken club, po'boy, muffuletta, breakfast egg sandwich, and the Reuben

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Turkey is not only for Thanksgiving! Martha presents roast turkey 101, roasted turkey in parchment paper, braised turkey legs, and roasted and rolled turkey breast with herbs

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha recreates four French bistro recipes you can make at home: lamb navarin, nicoise salad, croque-monsieur, and celery-root remoulade

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha makes her mother's meatloaf, burgers, and giant meatballs with ricotta. Guest butcher Pat LaFrieda makes Italian-style pork sausage

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Cooking with wine is one way to add flavor to food. Martha prepares four recipes using wine: beef bourguignon, cioppino (fish stew), chicken Marsala, and wine-poached pears

programme.title: Martha Stewart's Cooking School
programme.desc: Martha introduces her modern American take on four Italian favorites: eight-layer lasagna, chicken Parmesan, raviolo with egg yolk, and linguine with red or white clam sauce

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shows how to transform one basic recipe into three stunning celebration cakes: naked berry chiffon cake, caramel chiffon cake, and woodland stump cake

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Follow Martha as she creates delicious breakfast pastries with an easy-to-prepare yeast dough: pear and frangipane pastries, brown butter swirl, and jam-filled croustades

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shows how adding patterns can change your cookies, cakes, and tarts, including an apricot cheesecake tart, marbleized roulade, and brown butter honey cookies

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Ginger can add a peppery, sweet taste to your dishes. Martha demonstrates how to incorporate it: molasses-ginger crisps, ginger-pear hand pies, and lemon-ginger scones

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shares how to incorporate fresh cheeses into three delectable desserts: tart au fromage, cannoli cake, and cheesecake babka

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Martha shares her favorite recipes based on a simple and delicious yellow cake, including her father's birthday cake, stone fruit upside-down cake, and strawberry cupcakes

programme.title: Martha Bakes
programme.desc: Watch Martha demonstrate three delightfully rich pound cake recipes, from traditional to one inspired by her travels through Asia, using butter, cream cheese, and semolina

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.desc: Meet Martha's chickens! Now with over 200 chickens and 20 different breeds, Martha shares her vast knowledge about raising and caring for her flock. Then learn the how-tos of building the a coop.

programme.title: Martha Gardens
programme.sub-title: Martha Builds a Raised Bed Vegetable Garden
programme.desc: Martha builds a brand new, half-acre raised bed vegetable garden on her farm! It's a step-by-step guide to designing, building, preparing the soil, and planting.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Restaurant owners Angie Rito and Scott Tacinelli join Martha in making their rolled lasagna with San Marzano tomato sauce, Italian bolognese, and chrysanthemum Caesar salad.

programme.title: Martha Cooks
programme.desc: Martha, Monica Tran Carden, and Andrew Yu make homemade dumplings; Martha and Monica hand-make wontons and pork dumplings; Andrew and Martha prepare jade dumplings and pork and shrimp dumplings.
